abstracts.cdata!:
The ultimate objective of the
            Agricultural Recovery and Social Protection Credit (ARSP) is
            to reduce the widespread poverty in the country by: a)
            fostering an environment that is favorable to growth by
            supporting macroeconomic stabilization and policy reform;
            and b) protecting vulnerable groups during the transition
            period by improving the targeting and performance of the
            social safety net. The instruments employed by the ARSP
            Credit to achieve the dual goals will include: supporting
            the macroeconomic reform program; supporting
            Government's efforts to design and implement a policy
            reform program; providing non-inflationary resources to the
            budget; easing the severe foreign exchange and import
            constraints; easing the liquidity constraint on consumers by
            allowing regular payments of wages and salaries and
            producers by liberalizing prices and markets; and
            strengthening the targeting and performance of the safety
            net by focusing benefits on children, low income pensioners,
            and non-working pensioners.
